alert.note: Alert for Glacier; Lewis and Clark; Pondera; Teton (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 8:29PM MDT until June 09 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Glacier County in north central Montana... Northwestern Pondera County in north central Montana... Western Teton County in north central Montana... Northwestern Lewis and Clark County in west central Montana... * Until midnight MDT tonight. * At 829 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain has fallen across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen across much of the warned area, with locally higher amounts in the mountains. Additional thunderstorms over the plains of Central and North Central Montana will continue to move west and over the area through the remainder of the evening, leading to additional heavy rain. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, mountain roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Debris flows in steep mountainous terrain are likely to occur, especially near recently burned areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Heart Butte, Pishkun Reservoir, Dupuyer and Nilan Reservoir. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
